question: The arrow in this figure <image 1> is pointing to which part of the brain?
description: The image depicts a side view of a human brain with different regions colored in various shades. The arrow points to a specific area of the brain, which is colored pink. This region is located at the front of the brain, just behind the forehead, and is part of the frontal lobe. The other regions of the brain are colored differently: the top part is blue, the back part is yellow, and the lower part is purple. The pink region indicated by the arrow corresponds to the prefrontal cortex, which is a part of the cerebral cortex.
